title: Senior Software Engineer, Backend (Next.JS)
description:
1inch is the DeFi ecosystem building financial freedom for everyone. 1inch products help users and builders trade, hold and track digital assets \\- with the self\\-custody, comprehensive security and the intuitive user experience they need to unlock the potential of true crypto ownership. 1inch protocols and APIs provide core infrastructure across the DeFi industry and beyond.  

So if you’re someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry\\-changing team. *Location: We prioritise candidates who are based in Dubai then consider those working remotely in one of our European Hub Locations (UK, Spain or Germany).*  

The Senior Backend Engineer role focuses on developing high\\-performance, scalable backend systems, requiring expertise in node.js ecosystem (including Nest.js), microservices architecture design, monitoring tools, and different kind of storages. Contributor required to have a good knowledge about blockchain technologies. Contributor responsibilities related to the development of services for the whole 1inch infrastructure.
### **Responsibilities:**

* **Microservices Development:** Build and maintain scalable backend microservices using the Nest.js framework.
* **API Architecture:** Design and implement high\\-performance, low\\-latency APIs and backend systems.
* **System Reliability:** Monitor technical and business metrics, including error rates and uptime, to ensure service stability.
* **Performance Optimisation:** Conduct regular system profiling and optimise database queries to ensure high throughput.
* **Code Excellence:** Write clean, well\\-documented code while strictly adhering to internal standards and development guidelines.
* **Incident Management:** Set up and manage alerting systems for early detection and proactive mitigation of vulnerabilities.
* **Cross\\-Functional Collaboration:** Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and agile sprint planning sessions.
* **Continuous Innovation:** Stay abreast of emerging technologies to introduce new tools that enhance team efficiency and system performance.

### **Requirements:**

* **Industry Experience:** Proven track record working within fintech, DeFi, or cryptocurrency sectors.
* **High\\-Load Environments:** Practical experience developing microservices architecture capable of handling high\\-load traffic.
* **Tech Stack Proficiency:** Advanced proficiency in Node.js and TypeScript, supported by strong SQL skills and PostgreSQL experience.
* **Infrastructural Knowledge:** Familiarity with Redis, message brokers (such as NATS, EMQX, or Kafka), and monitoring tools like Prometheus and Grafana.
* **Blockchain Knowledge:** A solid understanding of blockchain fundamentals, Web3, and Solidity.
* **DevOps Basics:** Working knowledge of CI/CD pipelines, Docker, and fundamental Kubernetes concepts.
* **Operational Setup:** Ability to manage metrics pipelines and configure robust alerting systems.
* **Agile Mindset:** Experience working within Scrum\\-based environments with an enterprise\\-oriented focus on structure.
* **Communication \\& Mindset:** A proactive communicator with a quality\\-driven approach and strong problem\\-solving abilities.
* **Location \\& Presence:** Willingness to adhere to a hybrid schedule, including at least three days per week on\\-site at the Dubai office.

### **Skills:**

* **Backend Engineering:** Expert\\-level API design and backend system development.
* **Performance Analysis:** Proficient in system profiling and latency reduction techniques.
* **Security \\& Resilience:** Skilled in applying data protection best practices and building resilient systems.
* **Engineering Leadership:** Ability to promote best practices and mentor peers through consistent code reviews.
* **Technical Documentation:** Capability to produce thorough documentation for complex architectural designs.

### **Nice to have's:**

* **Advanced Framework Knowledge:** Hands\\-on experience or deep familiarity with the Nest.js framework.
* **Event\\-Driven Design:** Strong understanding of event\\-driven architecture and asynchronous patterns.
* **Web3 Tooling:** Experience using Web3 libraries, such as ethers.js or web3\\.js, for direct blockchain interactions

### **Why you'll love working with us:**

* Join a young, creative team in a fast\\-paced and supportive environment
* We’re open to new ideas — if you’ve got a vision, pitch it and make it happen
* Enjoy competitive pay that matches your skills and experience
* Be part of a company that’s shaping the future of DeFi
* Take time when you need it — we offer unlimited vacation days
* Get fully compensated for your work gear — we’ll set you up for success



We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

title: DevOps Teamleader
description:
**Yor Tasks:**
--------------

* Lead a team of 3\\-5 hosting engineers, setting clear objectives, providing mentorship, and fostering a collaborative and growth\\-oriented environment.
* Drive the migration/integration of hosting projects solutions to **Kubernetes (OVH vSphere and Azure)**. Define the technical roadmap and ensure seamless execution.
* Implement and improve processes for **monitoring, documentation, security, and CI/CD**. Automate workflows to enhance efficiency and reduce technical debt.
* Act as a change agent, proposing innovative solutions and best practices in DevOps and cloud technologies. Stay ahead of industry trends and tools.
* Work closely with DevOps, IT, and SaaS teams across Europe. Participate in Agile rituals and contribute to technical decision\\-making.
* Ensure the security and compliance of our cloud infrastructure (GDPR, industry standards). Promote a security\\-first mindset within the team in collaboration with the ciso.
**What you should bring:**
--------------------------

* You have at least 5 years of professional experience in DevOps, Site Reliability Engineering, or similar roles.
* You have experience leading technical teams or projects, demonstrating strong leadership, mentoring, and team\\-building skills.
* You have in\\-depth knowledge of Microsoft Azure, particularly services such as AKS, Azure Functions, App Services, VMs, VSphere, and VNETs or experience in other cloud vendors.
* You are proficient in at least one scripting language such as PowerShell, Bash, or Python.
* You have hands\\-on experience with containerization (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes).
* Your knowledge of network architectures, cloud security, and best practices is up to date.
* You are familiar with monitoring and logging tools such as Azure Monitor, Prometheus, Grafana, CheckMK or Zabbix.
* You work confidently with version control systems (e.g. Git) and have practical experience with CI/CD platforms.
* You bring a solution\\-oriented mindset, analytical thinking, and strong communication skills.
* Certifications in cloud or DevOps (e.g., CKA, Azure Solutions Architect, AWS DevOps, vSphere) are a plus.

Embedded Software Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
#### **Your mission**


We’re looking for an experienced and curious Embedded Software Engineer to join our Product \\& Engineering team. In this role, you’ll take ownership of our firmware and embedded systems — the core layer that powers Seroton’s unique relaxation experience.
  

  

You’ll work closely with the Co\\-Founder and collaborate with Hardware Production, Mobile Engineering and Product Experience. Part of a small, ambitious startup, you’ll have real impact from day one — shaping not just how our hardware works, but how our users feel.  

  

If you enjoy building thoughtful products, working hands\\-on with hardware, and turning science\\-driven insights into real experiences, this role is for you.  

  

**Key Responsibilities**

  

* Own Seroton’s embedded firmware stack end\\-to\\-end, from prototyping to testing to release and iteration
* Design and optimize embedded software for microcontroller\\-based systems with a focus on reliability and performance
* Develop and refine open\\- and closed\\-loop control systems for haptic and pneumatic actuation
* Build deep expertise in our SMA\\-based hardware and continuously improve system behavior
* Implement real\\-time sensor processing to enable interactive, user\\-facing experiences
* Option to contribute to future health\\-sensing algorithms for real\\-time mood and state tracking

#### **Your profile**

* Several years of experience in embedded software development on real, shipped products
* Comfort working at the intersection of hardware, firmware, and digital products
* A degree in Electrical Engineering, Robotics, Mechatronics, Physics, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
* A hands\\-on, entrepreneurial mindset — comfortable with ownership, ambiguity, and fast iteration
* Curiosity for new technologies and digital product development
* A passion for building and creating, with confidence using AI tools in your daily workflow
* Clear communication skills and enjoyment of cross\\-functional collaboration

#### **Why us?**

* **Hybrid work**: Flexible mix of remote and on\\-site work in Munich.
* **Growth opportunity**: Take real ownership, gain hands\\-on experience, and grow alongside a small but ambitious product team.
* **Impactful Work**: Contribute to a product that directly enhances mental wellbeing and helps people experience calm in a new way.


We’re excited to meet ambitious minds like yours. Apply now and let's build something amazing together!#### **About us**


Seroton is a fast\\-growing HealthTech startup redefining mental recovery.  

  

We merge the power of meditation and massage into an immersive, full\\-body experience—making relaxation effortless and effective. App\\-powered and device\\-enabled, our smart technology is seamlessly integrated into everyday furniture. The Seroton App acts as the intelligent bridge between hardware and software, delivering personalized experiences and serving as the personal companion for our users.

title: Sr. Expert Digital Product Engineering (m/f/d)
description:
We are looking to recruit, at the earliest possible date, a full\\-time and permanent **Software Developer (m/f/d) for scientific applications with a focus on Big Data** to strengthen our development team at KWS Saat SE \\& Co. KGaA in Einbeck, Lower Saxony.


The role involves replacing an existing application by a redevelopment. This application is a central component of plant breeding and molecular biology at various international KWS locations. You will work in an experienced SCRUM team and closely with a long\\-standing Product Owner from the field of molecular biology. Prior knowledge of plant breeding and genetics is not required, as this expertise will be provided by our specialists. After the onboarding period, remote work within Germany is possible.

 **Your tasks:**


You are convinced that understanding the domain is a fundamental requirement for efficient and effective software development. In workshops, you will analyse the business domain together with domain experts. Based on this, you will design and implement a suitable software solution in close cooperation with the users, using .NET, cloud technologies and data pipelines. Together with an experienced team of Data Architects and Data Engineers, you will master the migration of a relational system into the newly designed data lakehouse. Your team will implement new or existing interfaces and data services and will later be responsible for both the backend and an end\\-user frontend. At the same time, your team ensures the smooth operation of the legacy system. By applying modern DevOps practices, you guarantee reliable and efficient software operations.

 **Your profile:**

* University degree in computer science or a comparable qualification
* Very good knowledge of C\\# (.NET Core) and Python
* Practical experience with distributed systems, ideally in an AWS cloud environment or with Docker and Kubernetes
* Practical experience with DataLake technologies, such as Databricks or AWS Athena and Apache Spark
* Practical experience in professional software development (e.g., dependency injection, mocking, TDD, CI/CD pipelines)
* Confident handling of relational databases (PostgreSQL, Oracle) and AWS\\-based technologies in general
* Proficient in Azure DevOps, Jira or GitLab, version control with GIT, and agile working methods (SCRUM)
* Good command of English and German required

 **Our offer**

* As a family\\-run company, we live with the values of proximity, reliability, vision and independence \\- a culture that is also lived in practice, e.g. through an open and friendly working atmosphere.
* True to the motto: "Make yourself grow!", we promote individual professional and personal development.
* As a basis, we offer excellent work equipment, a full\\-fledged, subsidized canteen, direct rail connections and sufficient free parking spaces at the site.
* We create the appropriate framework conditions for you: flexible working hours and flexible remote opportunities within Germany, company pension scheme, capital\\-forming benefits, Christmas and holiday bonuses, preferential shares, childcare allowance, Job Bike \\& Job Ticket
* Health and safety are very important to us, which is ensured by the company doctor, company fire brigade / paramedic (with time credit) and company sports.

 **We look forward to receiving your application online.**

title: DevOps Engineer (all genders) – SaaS Services & Cloud Infrastructure
company: INFORM Institut für Operations Research und Management GmbH
description:
In our Risk \\& Fraud business unit, we develop SaaS solutions that help banks and insurance companies identify risks early and effectively prevent fraud. Our software is used in highly regulated, business\\-critical environments and therefore must meet the highest standards in terms of stability, security, and scalability.



As a DevOps Engineer (all genders), you ensure a reliable, automated, and secure operation of our platforms.


**What you can move with us:**
* You design, implement, and operate CI/CD pipelines for our SaaS services.
* Together with the team, you take ownership of the infrastructure – from setup and operation to continuous optimization.
* You work with Infrastructure as Code (e.g. Terraform) to create reproducible and stable environments.
* You support the development and operation of individual services and application services.
* You ensure monitoring, reliability, security, and compliance across our platforms.
* You collaborate closely with other team members to bring secure, high\\-performance, and reliable services into production.

**What you bring along:**
**Must\\-haves:**


* Several years of professional experience in a DevOps, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), or Software Engineering role.
* A very good understanding of Software Development Lifecycles (SDLC) in agile, product\\-driven environments.
* Enjoy working in cross\\-functional teams.
* A strong continuous improvement mindset and high willingness to learn.
* Very good English skills, both written and spoken.


**Technical stack / focus areas:**


* CI/CD \\& automation (design, implementation, maintenance, and operation).
* Cloud \\& Infrastructure as Code (e.g. Terraform).
* Containers \\& orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Monitoring, reliability, security \\& compliance, including data protection and operational risks.


**Nice to have:**


* Experience working in autonomous, cross\\-functional product teams.
* A deep understanding of the Product Operating Model (e.g. product ownership, continuous value delivery, outcome\\-oriented metrics).

**How we value your work:**
* Flexible working hours, hybrid work, workation, sabbatical
* U3 daycare as well as childcare subsidy
* Urban Sports Club membership and other health/sports offers e.g. bike leasing
* Long\\-term development prospects with a wide range of further training opportunities
* Varied, healthy and subsidized lunch in our canteen
* Large INFORM summer party, company and team events as well as a Christmas party

**Contact person:**

Kevin Kiesling . kevin.kiesling(at)inform\\-software.com . Tel. \\+49 (0\\) 2408 9456 0

title: Senior DevOps Engineer - Friedrichshafen area, Germany - Up to €85,000 (d / m / f)

Site Reliability Engineer, Software Delivery
description:
The Software Build Reliability Engineering team is at the core of Apple's software development process. We are responsible for delivering the state\\-of\\-the\\-art operating systems, applications, and firmware to Apple customers. Our team is the primary support group for production builds of macOS, iOS, watchOS, tvOS, Xcode, and more! We are on a mission to deliver reliable services that help engineers at Apple do their best work, with a globally distributed team for 24x7 coverage. You'll play a critical role in the day\\-to\\-day operations of services relied upon thousands across Apple. You'll work alongside engineering teams to ensure they're successful. You'll innovate for the future of our services by investing in platforms for deployments, observability, scalability and operability. We believe that every engineer brings unique skills and perspective. Far more than any specific experience or skill, we are looking for engineers who want to build great software, learn and develop their skills, and ultimately enable others to develop amazing applications.  

  

**Description**  

As part of Software Delivery Services \\& Infrastructure SRE, you will be responsible for delivering reliable services and driving projects to a successful outcome. This role will focus on operating and supporting a distributed development workflow used by teams in Software Engineering. You will monitor SLOs, respond to incidents, troubleshoot issues, and ensure the service is up\\-to\\-date and secure. You will collaborate with engineering teams to implement best practices and shape technical decisions. To ensure your success, this job will provide you with: Passionate and talented coworkers around the globe that are ready to collaborate, mentor, and learn from you. Ownership to drive meaningful improvements to the operational reliability of the services you manage. Opportunities to contribute to the best practices used by SRE teams within Software Delivery training in technologies that may be new to you.  

","responsibilities":"Deep understanding of Linux system administration and its implications for service reliability (MacOS is a plus)  

  

Expert\\-level troubleshooting and problem\\-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to diagnose and resolve complex issues under pressure.  

  

Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal), with the ability to clearly articulate technical concepts to both technical and non\\-technical.  

  

**Preferred Qualifications**  

Development experience with Go, Python, Swift, or similar languages  

  

CI/CD pipeline creation with Jenkins or similar services  

  

Proven ability to self\\-manage large, complex projects and consistently meet deadlines  

  

**Minimum Qualifications**  

Excellent understanding of micro\\-services architecture and its operational considerations.  

  

Exposure to Container orchestration with Kubernetes  

  

Experience leading and mentoring other engineers, fostering a culture of learning and continuous improvement  

  

At Apple, we’re not all the same. And that’s our greatest strength. We draw on the differences in who we are, what we’ve experienced, and how we think. Because to create products that serve everyone, we believe in including everyone. Therefore, we are committed to treating all applicants fairly and equally. We will work with applicants to make any reasonable accommodations.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Site Reliability Engineering
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages.
* 3 years of experience in designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting large\\-scale distributed systems.

2 years of experience leading projects and providing technical leadership.  
* 

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Experience working in computing, distributed systems, storage, or networking.
* Expertise in designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting large\\-scale distributed systems.
* Ability to debug, optimize code, and to automate routine tasks.
* Systematic problem\\-solving approach, coupled with effective verbal and written communication skills.

**About the job**
-----------------


Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) combines software and systems engineering to build and run large\\-scale, massively distributed, fault\\-tolerant systems. SRE ensures that Google Cloud's services—both our internally critical and our externally\\-visible systems—have reliability, uptime appropriate to customer's needs and a fast rate of improvement. Additionally SRE’s will keep an ever\\-watchful eye on our systems capacity and performance.  



  

Much of our software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure and eliminating work through automation. On the SRE team, you’ll have the opportunity to manage the complex challenges of scale which are unique to Google Cloud, while using your expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis and large\\-scale system design. SRE's culture of intellectual curiosity, problem solving and openness is key to its success. Our organization brings together people with a wide variety of backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. We encourage them to collaborate, think big and take risks in a blame\\-free environment. We promote self\\-direction to work on meaningful projects, while we also strive to create an environment that provides the support and mentorship needed to learn and grow.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services—from inception and design, through to deployment, operation and refinement.
* Support services before they go live through activities such as system design consulting, developing software platforms and frameworks, capacity planning and launch reviews.
* Maintain services once they are live by measuring and monitoring availability, latency and overall system health.
* Scale systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation, and evolve systems by pushing for changes that improve reliability and velocity.
* Practice sustainable incident response and blameless postmortems.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: IT System Engineer (m/w/d) – On-Prem & Hybrid Infrastrukturen
Full-time IT system administrator (m/f/d) for the Office for IT and Digitalization
NOC Technician
description:
**Introduction**
----------------



At Serco, we don’t just support space exploration—we help make it possible. For decades, we’ve been a trusted partner at ESA’s European Space Operations Centre (ESOC) in Darmstadt, Germany, playing a vital role in some of the most ambitious space missions humanity has ever undertaken. From spacecraft operations to ground systems and data processing, our expertise has earned us recognition, including ESA’s prestigious Best in Domain awards.


Every day, we work hand\\-in\\-hand with ESA to ensure mission success and push the boundaries of innovation.


Now, we’re looking for someone who wants to be part of this story. We currently have an exciting opportunity for a NOC Technician based at our customer site, ESOC.

**Your Mission**
----------------



Imagine stepping into the heart of a mission operations environment where every action you take keeps spacecraft connected, data flowing, and critical systems online. In this role, you become the coordinating force that ensures our operational ecosystem runs smoothly—day, night, and across continents.


Your mission begins at the intersection of engineering, operations, and real‑time decision‑making. Each day, you will collaborate closely with spacecraft operators, mission control teams, external partners, and ground stations around the world. You orchestrate the movements, aligning resources, schedules, and technical configurations so that missions receive the support they need—exactly when they need it.


You are the person who keeps our operational rhythm steady.


When a ground station must be configured in real time—whether during standard hours or in the quiet of the night—you are the one who ensures everything is ready, online, and performing at its best. You monitor station health, data flows, and system behaviours, catching anomalies before they escalate and taking swift action when something doesn’t look right.


And when the unexpected happens, you are the first line of defence.


You triage incidents, support users of critical systems, troubleshoot issues across applications, networks, and hardware, and escalate when required—all while maintaining clear communication with those who depend on you. Whether analysing a network fault, performing maintenance on CISCO components, or identifying root causes across TCP/IP‑based systems, you bring calm, clarity, and competence to high‑stakes situations.


Behind the scenes, your documentation becomes the backbone of operational knowledge. Logs, incident records, resolutions, and anomaly reports are all captured through your diligence. You contribute to user briefings, workshops, and operational reviews, helping ensure the whole organisation stays aligned and informed.


Your mission doesn’t stop there.


You operate within a structured shift system that ensures 24/7 service continuity, handing over seamlessly to colleagues and maintaining consistent service levels. You also play an active role in continuously improving processes, proposing enhancements, and identifying opportunities to refine how we deliver operational excellence.


From administrative upkeep to real‑time orchestration, from first‑response troubleshooting to enabling mission success—you are at the centre of it all.


This is your mission:  

to safeguard operational performance, elevate service reliability, and keep our missions connected to the world—every hour, every day.

**What You'll Bring**
---------------------



You’re someone who steps into a mission‑critical environment with a sense of calm confidence—because you know exactly what you’re doing and why it matters. You bring with you not just technical skills, but a mindset shaped by curiosity, accountability, and a drive to keep complex systems running flawlessly.


You understand the language of networks—WAN, LAN, routing, switching, connectivity—not as abstract terms, but as the living infrastructure that keeps operations alive. Troubleshooting to you isn’t a task; it’s a puzzle you’re eager to solve. You navigate system monitoring tools, logs, and dashboards with the natural instinct of someone who has spent time in real operational environments. When something looks off, you spot it early. When something breaks, you move fast.


You arrive with PC literacy and MS Office already in your toolkit, but your real strength lies in the way you apply logic to every situation. Fault diagnosis follows a path in your mind: identify, isolate, test, resolve. Whether the issue is a misconfigured network component or an unexpected system alert, your approach is structured, analytical, and reliable.


You understand the importance of IT security, even at a foundational level. You know that every action, every system, and every user connection plays a part in maintaining operational integrity.


But your technical skills are only part of the story.


You bring decisiveness, because you know that hesitation can cost time in environments where seconds matter. You carry accountability, taking ownership of tasks from start to finish. You communicate clearly in fluent English, ensuring users feel supported and informed. You bring a strong service ethic—courteous, responsive, and patient—even when the pressure rises.


You collaborate naturally, moving seamlessly between conversations with engineers, managers, and fellow operators. You’re a team player who respects the flow of information and the value of shared expertise. And you’re ready for the rhythm of 24/7 shift work, understanding that mission support doesn’t sleep—and neither does your commitment.

**Nice to Have — What Makes You Even More Exceptional**


Perhaps you’ve been part of remote operations of satellite ground stations, or supported the day‑to‑day running of a manned station. Maybe you already understand the inner workings of ESTRACK, or have experience navigating ITSM tools or the ITIL framework.


You might have touched environments involving VMS, Unix, Console Works, NetBackup, CD‑ROM production, CiscoWorks, HP‑OV, CISCO Firewalls, QIP, or MS Windows systems. If so, you already speak part of the language used here every day.


If you’ve mastered linear fault‑finding or enjoy coaching others, then you’re not just solving the problems of today—you’re helping the whole team prepare for tomorrow.

**What We Offer: More Than Just a Job**
---------------------------------------



Joining Serco at ESOC isn’t just about the work—it’s about the experience. We know that moving for a role like this is a big step, so we make sure you’re supported every step of the way:

* 30% discount on the Deutschland ticket for easy travel.
* Subsidised Wellpass – access to 12,500\\+ fitness and wellness options across Germany.
* Pension and health schemes.
* 30 days of holiday for balance and exploration.

  

This isn’t just a job—it’s a chance to build a career in space operations while enjoying a lifestyle that supports you every step of the way.

title: NOC Technician
description:

----------------



At Serco, we don’t just support space exploration—we help make it possible. ---------------------------------------



Joining Serco at ESOC isn’t just about the work—it’s about the experience. We know that moving for a role like this is a big step, so we make sure you’re supported every step of the way:

title: Application Manager MES & Data Architect (m/w/d)
description:
**Application Manager MES \\& Data Architect (m/w/d)**
=====================================================

Job Requisition ID: 2406
Location:
Ulm, DE, 89077
Company: HENSOLDT Sensors GmbH  

**Über den Bereich**

  



Für den Bereich "Information Management Design\\&Development" suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen "Application Manager MES \\& Data Architect (m/w/d)" an unserem Standort in Ulm.

  



Der Bereich ist verantwortlich für die Applikationen aller Fachbereiche der HENSOLDT Gruppe. Sie ist außerdem zuständig Vorschläge zu entwickeln sowie Projekte abzuwickeln, um die Digitalisierung der HENSOLDT Prozesse und Produkte voranzutreiben.

  



In dieser Schlüsselposition verbinden Sie produktionsnahe IT\\-Systeme (MES) mit einer modernen, zukunftsfähigen Daten\\- und Analytics\\-Landschaft. Sie verantworten den stabilen Betrieb und die Weiterentwicklung des MES\\-Systems Siemens Opcenter und gestalten zugleich als Data Architect die Datenstrukturen, Reporting\\- und BI\\-Lösungen, mit denen Produktions\\- und Unternehmensdaten nachhaltig nutzbar gemacht werden. Die Rolle vereint operative Nähe zur Produktion mit strategischer Datenarchitektur – von der Maschinen\\- und Prozessdatenerfassung bis hin zu skalierbaren Analytics\\- und BI\\-Lösungen.

  


**Ihre Aufgaben**

  


* Sicherstellung des stabilen Betriebs des MES\\-Systems Siemens Opcenter inklusive Fehleranalyse und Störungsbehebung (2nd/3rd Level Support)
* Betreuung, Wartung und Optimierung der produktionsnahen IT\\-Systeme und der zugrunde liegenden MS\\-SQL\\-Datenbanken
* Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Produktion, IT und Fachbereichen zur Umsetzung von Systemanpassungen, Erweiterungen und Releasewechseln
* Unterstützung und aktive Mitgestaltung von Digitalisierungs\\- und Industrie\\-4\\.0\\-Projekten im Produktionsumfeld
* Pflege, Weiterentwicklung und strategischer Ausbau des Data Warehouse (DWH) sowie angebundener Analytics\\-Plattformen
* Verantwortung für die ETL\\-Strecken: Konzeption, Automatisierung und Optimierung der Datenlade\\- und Integrationsprozesse
* Entwicklung konsistenter Datenmodelle und Datenflüsse zwischen MES, angrenzenden Systemen und Analytics\\-Plattformen
* Mitgestaltung moderner Datenarchitekturen mit Fokus auf Skalierbarkeit und Zukunftssicherheit
* Konzeption, Umsetzung und Weiterentwicklung von Reporting\\- und BI\\-Lösungen (z. B. Power BI)
* Übersetzung von Produktions\\- und Geschäftsdaten in aussagekräftige KPIs und Entscheidungsgrundlagen
* Begleitung des gesamten Lebenszyklus von Analytics\\-Lösungen – von der Anforderungsanalyse bis zum produktiven Betrieb

  


**Ihr Profil**

  


* Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Ingenieurwissenschaften, Data Science oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
* Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Application Management von MES\\-Systemen, idealerweise Siemens Opcenter
* Fundierte Kenntnisse in relationalen Datenbanken (MS SQL) sowie in Datenmodellierung
* Sehr gute Erfahrung mit ETL\\-Prozessen, DWH\\-Architekturen und Analytics\\-Plattformen (insb. Microsoft Stack)
* Praxis im Umgang mit BI\\-Tools (z. B. Power BI) und ein gutes Verständnis für Produktionskennzahlen und KPIs
* Idealerweise Erfahrung mit containerisierter Software und Orchestrierung (z. B. Docker, Kubernetes, Apache Airflow) sowie Python
* Grundkenntnisse moderner Datenarchitektur\\-Konzepte (Data Lake, Cloud, IoT/KI von Vorteil)
* Analytische, strukturierte Arbeitsweise und hohe Problemlösungskompetenz
* Sehr gute Deutsch\\- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

  



Do you want to become part of a future\\-oriented company? And are you ready to take on responsibility in exciting international and national projects? Then you are our candidate!  

Please apply exclusively online via our career portal with your CV and references.

  



In case you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact our Recruiting Team: jobs@hensoldt.net

  



Find out more about HENSOLDT and our jobs: www.hensoldt.net/career

  


**Become our next pioneer. Apply now and become part of the HENSOLDT team!**

  



HENSOLDT is committed to diversity and an inclusive corporate culture. We therefore welcome all applications \\- regardless of origin, age, gender, disability, identity or ideology.

title: Application Firmwareentwickler für Radarsignalverarbeitungsanwendungen auf FPGA (w/m/d)
description:
**Application Firmwareentwickler für Radarsignalverarbeitungsanwendungen auf FPGA (w/m/d)**
===========================================================================================

Job Requisition ID: 3356
Location:
Ulm, DE, 89077
Company: HENSOLDT Sensors GmbH  

**Über den Bereich**

  



Für den Bereich "Radar Processing Application \\& UI" suchen wir am Standort Ulm zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen "Application Firmwareentwickler für unsere Radarsignalverarbeitungsanwendungen auf FPGA (w/m/d)".

  



Wir bieten ein spannendes und vielseitiges Aufgabenspektrum: Schwerpunktmäßig entwickeln wir sowohl die Signal\\- und Datenverarbeitungsanwendungen sowie die Test\\- und Bedienersoftware (HMI) für die Radarprozessoren unserer Naval \\& Ground Radar Produktfamilien.

  



Die hochleistungsfähigen Hardwareplattformen unserer Radarprozessoren basieren dabei auf einem Zusammenspiel aus CPUs, GPUs und FPGAs.

  



Bei der Entwicklung kommen moderne Methoden aus den Bereichen Model\\-Driven Development sowie Continuous Integration und Continuous Delivery zum Einsatz.

  


**Ihre Aufgaben**

  


* Implementierung der geforderten Signalverarbeitungsalgorithmen und Features auf FPGAs mit Hilfe von MATLAB / Simulink / DSP\\-Builder und VHDL
* Erstellung der zugehörigen Firmware\\-Modultests sowie der \\-Dokumentation
* Bewertung und Optimierung der geforderten Signalverarbeitungsalgorithmen und Features hinsichtlich Umsetzbarkeit auf der Zielhardware
* Erstellung und Abstimmung der Firmwareanforderungen sowie der \\-architektur für einzelne Firmwaremodule
* Integration und Test der Firmwaremodule auf dem Zielsystem
* Unterstützung bei der Durchführung der Firmware\\-Abnahme auf dem Zielsystem
* Erstellen von Test\\- und Integrationstools in Python, C\\+\\+ und MATLAB
* Unterstützung der Systemintegrationsaktivitäten

  


**Ihr Profil**

  


* Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Elektrotechnik, Physik, Mathematik oder vergleichbar
* Praktische Erfahrung bei der Spezifikation, dem Design, der Implementierung sowie dem Test komplexer Firmware\\-Module
* Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Firmware\\-Entwicklung für (Intel\\-)FPGAs
* Kenntnisse über agile Entwicklungsprozesse, Continuous Integration und die zugehörigen Werkzeuge (Atlassian, git)
* Programmierkenntnisse in Python, C/C\\+\\+ und MATLAB wünschenswert
* Kenntnisse in der (Radar\\-)Signalverarbeitung vorteilhaft
* Proaktive, strukturierte sowie lösungs\\- und kundenorientierte Arbeitsweise
* Ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit
* Sehr gute Deutsch\\- und gute Englischkenntnisse

  



Do you want to become part of a future\\-oriented company? And are you ready to take on responsibility in exciting international and national projects? Then you are our candidate!  

Please apply exclusively online via our career portal with your CV and references.

  



In case you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact our Recruiting Team: jobs@hensoldt.net

  



Find out more about HENSOLDT and our jobs: www.hensoldt.net/career

  


**Apply now!**

  



HENSOLDT is committed to diversity and an inclusive corporate culture. We therefore welcome all applications \\- regardless of origin, age, gender, disability, identity or ideology.

title: Working Student - Forward Deployed Engineer (f/m/div)
description:
\\#WeAreIn to create tiny chips and big careers. The future won’t wait... why should you? Join us and make a difference. Whether you join as a student, intern, or trainee, you'll be part of something real \\- real projects, real impact, and real opportunities to grow. Are you in?  

  

**Your Role**  

*This role involves designing, developing, and evaluating AI workflows and tools, as well as contributing to the creation of reusable resources and supporting integration with larger platforms.*  

  

Key responsibilities in your new role  

* **Keep the overview**: Work on AI projects from start to finish, designing and implementing tools and workflows, with guidance from the team, to create tested prototypes
* **Reliable work:** Building and evaluating workflows, designing prompts and tools, and creating robust error handling mechanisms, as well as developing evaluation setups to test the quality of the workflows
* **Take responsibility**: Developing and prototyping machine learning models for reliability and quality analytics, such as outlier detection and predictive models, and packaging the results in a reproducible manner
* **Expand your horizons:** Contribute to creating a reusable "starter kit" with templates and documentation, and support the integration of the AI workflows into larger platforms by producing clear interfaces, tests, and documentation

  

**Your Profile**  

  

Qualifications and skills to help you succeed  

* **Study field:** Enrolled in a Master’s program (or advanced Bachelor) in Computer Science, Data Science, Physics, Electrical Engineering or similar
* **Skills:**
	+ Have strong Python skills (pandas/NumPy), and ideally first experience with FastAPI/Streamlit or building small services
	+ Comfortable with Git, code reviews, and writing maintainable code (tests are a plus)
	+ Understand basic ML concepts (train/test split, metrics, overfitting); PyTorch/scikit\\-learn experience is a plus
* **Experience:** First hands\\-on experience with LLMs/agents (prompting, tool calling, evaluation) and are motivated to go deeper
* **Way of working:** You can work independently on ambiguous tasks (clarify requirements, propose options, and drive to a result), and can collaborate with engineers and domain experts
* **Language skills:** You are fluent in English (German is a plus)


Please attach the following documents to your application:  

* CV in English
* Certificate of enrollment at university
* Latest grades transcript (not older than 6 months)
* High school report


Important information:  

* **Working part\\-time**: The focus is on studies. That’s why working as a student employee during lecture period is limited to a maximum of 20 hours per week.
* **Proper students (according to the German law) are welcome**: To work as a student employee with us, you must be enrolled at a university and not have completed all of your exams or modules for your degree programme. You must not be in a semester of leave. We look forward to welcoming you to our team for at least 6 months.
* **You should live close to the site**: For good collaboration, it is important to us that you can come to the office regularly to integrate to the team.

  

**Contact:**  

 Mafalda Porto **\\#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.**  

As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game\\-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener.  

**Are you in?**  

  

**Further links:**

  

* Find out what we are looking for in your CV
* Find out how the student application process works with us
* Discover our student website

  

**We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.**  

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant´s experience and skills. Learn more about our various contact channels.  

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.  

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.  

Click here for more information about Diversity \\& Inclusion at Infineon.

title: Senior Backend Developer (d/w/m)
description:
Paymenttools hat es sich zur Aufgabe gemacht, die Zahlungslandschaft für Händler in Europa zu verändern. Mit mehr als 4,4 Milliarden Besuchern pro Jahr in unseren mehr als 15\\.000 REWE Group Märkten und Reisebüros in 21 Ländern wissen wir genau, was Verbraucher und Händler brauchen, wenn es ums Bezahlen geht. Wir glauben fest daran, Zahlungen nahtlos und unsichtbar zu machen und sie mit Value Added Services im Rahmen eines zuverlässigen Identitätsdienstes zu verknüpfen. Unser Mantra: \\#wesolvepayn. Wir verbinden modernste Technologie mit strenger Sicherheit, um sensible Zahlungsdaten zu schützen und gleichzeitig Innovationen in einer Cloud\\-nativen Technologieumgebung zu fördern.



Wir suchen einen Senior Backend Engineer zur Verstärkung eines unserer agilen Scrum\\-Teams. Du wirst an der Entwicklung und Weiterentwicklung unserer zentralen Zahlungsfunktionen mitwirken – von der sicheren Datenverarbeitung und dem Onboarding von Händlern bis hin zu skalierbaren Services, die neue Zahlungsmethoden ermöglichen. Wenn Du gerne End\\-to\\-End an Produkten mitarbeitest, die in großem Umfang wichtig sind, und Du komplexe Probleme in elegante, zuverlässige Systeme verwandelst, wirst Du Dich bei uns wie zu Hause fühlen.

  


### **Deine Aufgaben**


* Entwickle, gestalte und pflege Backend\\-Services, die sicher, skalierbar und konform sind – und Millionen von Zahlungstransaktionen und Händlerkonfigurationen unterstützen.
* Baue und entwickle Microservices in einer modernen Cloud\\-Umgebung (wir nutzen die Google Cloud Platform) weiter, um Zuverlässigkeit und Performance in großem Maßstab zu gewährleisten.
* Übernehme die Verantwortung für Funktionen End\\-to\\-End: vom technischen Design und der Implementierung bis hin zur Bereitstellung, dem Monitoring und der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung (*You build it, you run it*).
* Entwickle und verbessere kundenorientierte APIs, um robuste, gut dokumentierte Integrationspunkte für unsere Partner und internen Konsumenten bereitzustellen.
* Stärke die Plattformarchitektur mit Fokus auf Sicherheit, Observability und Wartbarkeit.
* Trage zu DevOps\\-Praktiken bei: CI/CD\\-Pipelines, Monitoring und Best Practices für die Infrastruktur.
* Arbeite eng mit Engineers, dem Produktteam und Stakeholdern zusammen, um Lösungen zu liefern, die das Zahlungserlebnis für Händler und Endkunden verbessern.
* Lerne ständig dazu, teile Dein Wissen und hilf dabei, den technischen Standard im gesamten Unternehmen anzuheben.

### **Deine Erfahrungen**


* 7\\+ Jahre professionelle Erfahrung im Backend Engineering in einer relevanten Rolle, idealerweise in Bereichen mit hohem Transaktionsvolumen (*high\\-throughput*) oder in regulierten Domänen.
* Ausgeprägte Kenntnisse in JVM\\-Technologien wie Java und/oder Kotlin, sowie mit Spring / Spring Boot und ORM\\-Frameworks.
* Fundiertes Verständnis von Microservice\\-Architekturen, verteilten Systemen und API\\-Design.
* Praktische Cloud\\-Erfahrung (GCP oder AWS), einschließlich Containerisierung und Orchestrierung mit Docker/Kubernetes.
* Erfahrung mit CI/CD\\-Tools und *Operational Excellence*: Monitoring, Alerting und Performance Tuning mit Tools wie Prometheus und Grafana.
* Starker Hintergrund in Sicherheitsthemen wie Authentifizierung/Autorisierung, Verschlüsselung/Entschlüsselung (*encryption/decryption*) und sicherer Datenspeicherung.
* Sicherer Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken (Schema\\-Design, Transaktionen, Query\\-Optimierung) und idealerweise Vertrautheit mit NoSQL\\-Datenbanken.
* Fließendes Englisch (Arbeitssprache). Deutschkenntnisse sind ein Plus.
* Erfahrung mit Frontend\\-Entwicklung (TypeScript, React) ist ein Plus – besonders, wenn Du gerne über den gesamten Stack hinweg zusammenarbeitest.
* Kenntnisse der Zahlungsbranche (PCI\\-DSS, Tokenisierung, Compliance, Betrugs\\-/AML\\-Konzepte) und im Umgang mit Parallelität (*concurrency management*) sind von Vorteil, aber keine Voraussetzung.

### **Benefits**


* Deutschland\\-Ticket, subventioniertes Abonnement
* 1\\.000 Euro jährliches Entwicklungs\\- und Weiterbildungsbudget \\+ interne Schulungs Plattformen
* Rabatte auf Reisen, Mode, Technik und mehr durch unsere Corporate Benefits
* REWE Rabattkarte für Preisnachlässe bei Einzelhändlern der REWE\\-Gruppe
* JobRad, günstiges Fahrrad Leasing!
* Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
* Versicherungsdienstleistungen

### **Vorteile, wenn Du mit uns arbeitest**


* Wir sind hybrid
* Flexible Arbeitszeiten, die zu Deinem Arbeitsablauf passen, Deine Zeit ist wichtig!
* Verantwortung vom ersten Tag an
* Profitiere von Sprachkursen in Englisch als auch Deutsch
* Arbeite mit moderner und agiler Software wie Google Workspace, Slack, Asana, Jira, Lattice, Miro und Confluence
* Firmenevents wie Hackathons und Company Days (frag uns bei Interesse dazu!)

  



Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen. Auch wenn Du das Gefühl hast, dass Du nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllst, die Stelle Dich aber dennoch reizt und Du gerne mit uns zusammenarbeiten würdest, melde Dich bitte! Wir würden uns freuen, von Dir zu hören. Wir ermutigen ausdrücklich Bewerber aus Gruppen, die in der Tech\\-Branche derzeit unterrepräsentiert sind. Wir schätzen alle Arten von Hintergründen und Lebensläufen.

title: DevOps Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
* 38440 Wolfsburg
* Präsenz / Mobil
* Vollzeit
* Publiziert: 10\\.12\\.2025
* Unbefristet

Für die Abteilung Betrieb.  

  

Die WOBCOM GmbH ist eine hundertprozentige Tochterfirma der Unternehmensgruppe Stadtwerke Wolfsburg AG. Wir versorgen seit 1996 Wolfsburg, Gifhorn und die Region mit modernen Telekommunikationsdienstleistungen aus den Bereichen Telefonie, Internet, Mobilfunk und TV und bieten mit rund 100 Mitarbeitern maßgeschneiderte Leistungen für Privat\\- und Geschäftskunden.**So bringst du dich bei uns ein**
----------------------------------


* Du bist zuständig für die Konzeption, Implementierung und Weiterentwicklung von Continuous Integration, Deployment und Delivery
* Zu deinen Aufgaben gehört der Betrieb, das Monitoring und die Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden und neuen Microservices und API's
* Du erstellst und pflegst Dokumentationen
* Du arbeitest mit verschiedenen internen und externen Teams zusammen
**Wie du uns überzeugen kannst**
--------------------------------

* Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit informationstechnischem Hintergrund oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
* Du besitzt mehrjährige Erfahrung in CI/CD Deployment in Kubemetes Umgebungen
* Du verfügst über einen soliden Umgang mit Linux\\-Serversystemen, CLI und GitLab CI/CD\\-Pipelines
* Du hast Erfahrungen mit Helm\\-Charts
* Beim Thema Datenbanken kennst du dich aus (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Influxx, Redis)
* Erste Programmiererfahrungen sind von Vorteil (z.B. Python, GoLang)
* Ebenso von Vorteil sind IoT Erfahrungen (MQTT, Chirpstack)
* Du hast ein hohes technisches Verständnis sowie ein konzeptionelles und analytisches Denken
* Du bist lernbereit, zeigst Eigeninitiative und Teamfähigkeit
* Belastbarkeit, Flexibilität und Zuverlässigkeit zeichnen dich aus
* Du hast gute Deutschkenntnisse (mind. B1\\-Niveau) in Wort und Schrift
**Unsere Benefits für dich**
----------------------------

* Attraktive Vergütung nach Tarifvertrag TV\\-V, vermögenswirksame Leistungen, eine Jahressonderzahlung (Weihnachtsgeld) sowie Energierabatt
* Unbefristeter Arbeitsplatz in Vollzeit
* 30 Tage Urlaub sowie 24\\.12\\. und 31\\.12\\. frei
* Betriebliche Altersvorsorge (VBL)
* Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung, um Berufs\\- und Privatleben optimal miteinander vereinbaren zu können
* Mitarbeiterevents
* Modernes Arbeitsumfeld
* Etwa ein Tag Mobile Arbeit möglich
* Individuelle Entwicklungs\\- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
* JobRad / Bike Leasing
* Firmenfitness und Gesundheitsförderung, z. B. mit EGYM Wellpass
* Betriebsrestaurant
* Sehr gute Anbindung mit dem Auto, Optimale Verkehrsanbindung an den ÖPNV (Bus und Bahn) sowie mit dem Rad
* Angenehmes Arbeits\\- und Betriebsklima
**Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung**
--------------------------------------


Bitte beachte, dass wir Bewerbungen aus Datenschutzgründen ausschließlich über das Bewerberportal und nicht per E\\-Mail oder in Papierform annehmen können. Vielen Dank für dein Verständnis.  

  

**Fragen zum Recruiting\\-Prozess beantwortet dir**
* Lina Janke
* Bereich Personal
* 05361 189\\-3484

title: Founding AI Engineer
description:
The construction industry loses $1\\.6 trillion annually to inefficiencies. A huge part? Repeating the same mistakes over and over because critical information is still stuck in paperwork and scattered systems.
  
  

alago fixes this by putting existing data to work, instead of letting documentation gather dust. We help teams eliminate double data entry and manual busywork by connecting to existing tools, processing project data, and automating workflows between people and AI. With every project, alago gets more powerful —spotting risks and turning past challenges into future wins.
  
  

We’ve just raised a seven\\-figure pre\\-seed led by top construction tech VCs and one of Germany’s largest project developers. 75% of the infrastructure that will exist in 2050 does not exist today. Let’s build it better!
  
  

Aufgaben
  
  

As one of our first hires, you'll have unprecedented technical autonomy to architect novel AI systems from the ground up, working directly with founders who understand that breakthrough AI requires both deep technical expertise and creative freedom.
  
  

You'll be solving genuinely hard AI problems that don't have established solutions—the kind that require reading papers, prototyping novel approaches, and pushing the boundaries of what's possible in production systems.
  
  

* Design novel AI architectures: Build production agentic systems that go far beyond simple LLM wrappers—create sophisticated multi\\-agent workflows with custom reasoning, memory, and tool\\-use patterns.
* Push the limits of multimodal AI: Work with some of the most challenging unstructured data you've encountered (construction documents, images…) and develop novel approaches to extract structured insights at scale.
* Own the full research\\-to\\-production pipeline: From experimenting with cutting\\-edge techniques to building robust evaluation frameworks to optimizing inference at scale—you control the entire technical journey.
* Build AI\\-first infrastructure: Design and implement novel data pipelines, vector architectures, and evaluation systems that enable rapid experimentation while maintaining production reliability.


**What makes this role unique:**  

* $500\\+/month AI budget for experimentation with latest models and techniques
* Direct customer feedback loop to validate AI performance in real\\-world scenarios
* No legacy constraints—green field opportunity to implement state\\-of\\-the\\-art approaches
* Research freedom to explore and implement novel techniques from recent papers


You'll be working closely with Vinzenz (CTO) and Ann (CPO) \\- both technical founders who understand that great AI requires both deep technical investment and product intuition.
  
  

**Our Stack:**  

**Tech at a glance:** TypeScript, Next.js, Vercel, Supabase (PostgreSQL \\+ pgvector), LangChain, Vercel AI SDK, LangFuse, TanStack Query
  
  

Qualifikation
  
  

This is the perfect role for an AI engineer who wants to join an early\\-stage company and push the boundaries of what's possible with AI in construction.
  
  

**Must\\-Haves:**  

* C1 fluency in German – You'll work with complex construction industry data and need to understand domain nuances to build effective AI systems that actually solve real problems.
* 2\\+ years building production AI systems – You've shipped AI features that real users depend on, not just experimented with APIs. You understand the gap between "demo magic" and production reliability.
* TypeScript proficiency – When your AI system needs a frontend interface or API integration, you can build it without waiting for other team members.
* Shipping velocity – You prototype fast, measure everything, and iterate based on real user feedback. When you say "I'll build an AI feature to solve this," it ships within days, not months.


**Bonus Points:**  

* Previous startup experience – especially if you were the "AI person" who had to figure everything out
* Domain expertise in construction, manufacturing, or other complex industries with messy data
* Open source contributions or impressive side projects in AI/ML
* You've built AI systems that replaced hours of manual work – show us the impact


Benefits
  
  

As one of our first hires, you’ll do more than contribute — you’ll help shape how Alago works: our culture, systems, and growth strategy. You’ll work directly with the founders, gain exposure to every function, and ship projects that have immediate impact.
  
  

* 10× Learning Curve. Work with cutting\\-edge AI to tackle real\\-world challenges every day
* You ship fast and own the outcome. You’ll design solutions that take the pain out of project management, automating away the repetitive tasks and overhead teams hate.
* Work directly with the founders. You’ll own critical parts of alago end\\-to\\-end, laying the technical foundation while balancing rapid iteration, customer value, and long\\-term scalability.
* A vibrant in\\-office culture in our central Munich office. We come together in our Munich office at least three days a week. Beyond that, you’re welcome to work remotely for a few weeks at a time whenever your circumstances or preferences require it.
* Competitive salary \\& meaningful equity stake, so you are invested in our success
* Your needs and well\\-being matter to us. You’ll get access to sponsored EGYM Wellpass to find inner peace at yoga or kill it at HIIT workouts.


We’re building for scale — but right now, it’s still early. That means lots of autonomy, tight feedback loops, and the freedom to grow into whatever role suits your strengths, whether that’s become top individual contributor or stepping into leadership roles like VP Engineering.
  
  

About the application process
  
  

1\\\\. Submit your story
  
  

* Tell us about something you built that had real impact.


2\\\\. Intro Call (30min)
  
  

* Intro, Logistics \\& Fit with a founder.


3\\\\. Product \\& Tech Deep Dive (30min)
  
  

* Get to know Product and Tech with a founder.


4\\\\. Technical Interview (90min)
  
  

* Tackle a systems design and coding challenge.


5\\\\. On\\-site Project (0\\.5\\-1 day)
  
  

* Join us at our Munich office to plan, build and ship a small feature together.


6\\\\. Offer
  
  

* We’ll get back to you within 24 hours. If it’s a fit — let’s go!


Alago is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or gender identity. Please do not submit personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, trade union membership, data concerning your health, or data concerning your sexual orientation.

title: 2026 Software Dev Engineer Intern - Germany
description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


Please note the role is available across multiple locations in Germany.  

  

Do you want to solve real customer problems through innovative technology? Do you enjoy working on scalable services in a collaborative team environment? Do you want to see your code directly impact millions of customers worldwide?  

  

At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build on behalf of our customers. Customer obsession is part of our company DNA, which has made us one of the world's most beloved brands.  

  

Our Software Development Engineer (SDE) interns use modern technology to solve complex problems while seeing their work's impact first\\-hand. The challenges SDE interns solve at Amazon are meaningful and influence millions of customers, sellers, and products globally. We seek individuals passionate about creating new products, features, and services while managing ambiguity in an environment where development cycles are measured in weeks, not years.
  

  

At Amazon, we believe in ownership at every level. As an SDE intern, you'll own the entire lifecycle of your code \\- from design through deployment and ongoing operations. This ownership mindset, combined with our commitment to operational excellence, ensures we deliver the highest quality solutions for our customers.  

  

We're looking for curious minds who think big and want to define tomorrow's technology. At Amazon, you'll grow into the high impact engineer you know you can be, supported by a culture of learning and mentorship. Every day brings exciting new challenges and opportunities for personal growth.  

  

Amazon internships across all seasons are full\\-time positions, and interns should expect to work in office, Monday\\-Friday, up to 40 hours per week typically between 8am\\-5pm. Specific team norms around working hours will be communicated by your manager. Interns should not have conflicts such as classes or other employment during the Amazon workday.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Collaborate and communicate effectively with experienced cross\\-disciplinary Amazonians to design, build, and operate innovative products and services that delight our customers, while participating in technical discussions to drive solutions forward.
* Design and develop scalable solutions using cloud\\-native architectures and microservices in a large distributed computing environment.
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to technical documentation.
* Build and maintain resilient distributed systems that are scalable, fault\\-tolerant, and cost\\-effective.
* Leverage and contribute to the development of GenAI and AI\\-powered tools to enhance development productivity while staying current with emerging technologies.
* Write clean, maintainable code following best practices and design patterns.
* Demonstrate operational excellence through monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolving production issues.

  

A day in the life  

As an intern, you will be matched to a manager and a mentor and will have the opportunity to influence the evolution of Amazon technology and lead critical projects early in your career.
  

  

In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in activities with other interns throughout your internship. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your project and learn in a real\\-world setting.  

  

About the team  

Intern Community:  

  

As an Amazon Intern, you'll be part of a vibrant, supportive community that empowers your growth and development. You'll collaborate with interns from around the world, networking and participating in social events to broaden your perspectives. You can also join specialized groups focused on areas like sustainability to explore your diverse interests.  

  

Support:  

  

The internship program provides a robust support system, including weekly intern office hours, dedicated IT and HR support, and a program team committed to your success. This ensures you have the guidance and assistance needed to thrive.  

  

Learning Sessions:  

  

Exclusive learning sessions will further enhance your skills, granting you access to Amazon's cutting\\-edge learning platforms and the expertise of industry leaders. These structured development opportunities will prepare you for the next step in your career.  

  

Opportunities:  

  

Upon successful completion of the internship, you may be considered for a graduate role or a second internship, allowing you to continue your journey with Amazon. Additionally, you'll enjoy a competitive monthly salary, relocation support, and access to a range of employee benefits.
**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* Are enrolled in a Bachelor's degree or above in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields at time of application
* Knowledge of programming languages such as C/C\\+\\+, Python, Java or Perl
* Knowledge of computer science fundamentals such as object\\-oriented design, operating systems, algorithms, data structures, and complexity analysis

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* Experience from a technical internship
* Experience with distributed, multi\\-tiered systems, algorithms, and relational databases
* Experience in optimization mathematics such as linear programming and nonlinear optimization
* Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
* Adept at handling ambiguous or undefined problems as well as ability to think abstractly

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

m/w/d  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how\\-we\\-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Java Software Entwickler:in (w/d/m)
description:
**Java Software Entwickler:in (w/d/m)**
=======================================


Wir sind der führende Softwarehersteller von integrierten HCM\\-Anwendungen für staatliche, öffentliche und soziale Arbeitgeber in der Bundesrepublik. Unser Produkt KIDICAP® ist seit 40 Jahren auf dem Markt und wird heute von rund 25\\.000 Organisationen als Cloud Service genutzt. KIDICAP® bildet eine moderne APP\\-Plattform für alle Bereiche des Human Capital Managements und alle Unternehmensgrößen.


* Vertragsarten: Vollzeit,Teilzeit

**Angebot**
-----------


* Arbeit in einem kollegialen, familienfreundlichen Unternehmen mit flachen Hierarchien
* Eine anspruchsvolle und sinnstiftende Tätigkeit in einer agilen Arbeitsumgebung mit offenen Kommunikationsstrukturen
* flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit vollständig im Home\\-Office oder an einem unserer modernen Standorte zu arbeiten
* regelmäßige Fort\\- und Weiterbildungsangebote
* ein Prämiensystem, dass Dich am Unternehmenserfolg beteiligt
* eine arbeitgeberfinanzierte betriebliche Altersvorsorge
* regelmäßige Events

**Aufgaben**
------------


* Du entwickelst Komponenten für die Software as a Service Plattform
* Du arbeitest an thematischen Web\\-APPs für die Personalwirtschaft
* Du konzipierst passende Tests und analysierst die Ergebnisse
* Du planst und beschreibst das Backlog zusammen mit den Product Ownern

**Profil**
----------


* Du hast eine akademische oder gleichwertige Ausbildung als Informatiker (w/d/m) oder Ingenieur (w/d/m)
* Du besitzt Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung mit Java, Jakarta Enterprise sowie Cloud Native Entwicklung
* Du verfügst über erste Kenntnisse im Umgang mit JPA Hibernate, CDI, Restful Services und API Design
* Du hast Erfahrungen mit relationalen Datenbanken, am besten ORACLE DBMS
* Du konntest bereits Erfahrungen in Test Driven Development und Continuous Integration sammeln
* Du begeisterst Dich für neue technologischen Entwicklungen und willst unsere zukünftige Entwicklung mitgestalten

**Über uns**
------------


Wenn Du Teil eines agilen Teams werden möchten, dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung mit nächstmöglichem Eintrittstermin und Gehaltsvorstellung.
